22namespace v8 {
23namespace internal {

25class MemoryAllocator;
26class ReadOnlyHeap;
27class SnapshotByteSource;
28
29class ReadOnlyPageMetadata : public MemoryChunkMetadata {
30 public:
31 ReadOnlyPageMetadata(Heap* heap, BaseSpace* space, size_t chunk_size,
32 Address area_start, Address area_end,
33 VirtualMemory reservation);
34 MemoryChunk::MainThreadFlags InitialFlags() const;
35
36 // Clears any pointers in the header that point out of the page that would
37 // otherwise make the header non-relocatable.
38 void MakeHeaderRelocatable();
39
40 size_t ShrinkToHighWaterMark();
41
42 // Returns the address for a given offset in this page.
43 Address OffsetToAddress(size_t offset) const {
44 Address address_in_page = ChunkAddress() + offset;
45 if (V8_SHARED_RO_HEAP_BOOL && COMPRESS_POINTERS_IN_MULTIPLE_CAGES_BOOL) {
46 // Pointer compression with multiple pointer cages and shared
47 // ReadOnlyPages means that the area_start and area_end cannot be defined
48 // since they are stored within the pages which can be mapped at multiple
49 // memory addresses.
50 DCHECK_LT(offset, size());
51 } else {
52 DCHECK_GE(address_in_page, area_start());
53 DCHECK_LT(address_in_page, area_end());
54 }
55 return address_in_page;
56 }
57
58 // Returns the start area of the page without using area_start() which cannot
59 // return the correct result when the page is remapped multiple times.
60 Address GetAreaStart() const {
61 return ChunkAddress() +
62 MemoryChunkLayout::ObjectStartOffsetInMemoryChunk(RO_SPACE);
63 }
64
65 // A special case of the ChunkAddress since the ReadOnlyMetadata is inlined in
66 // the MemoryChunk.
67 Address ChunkAddress() const {
68 return MemoryChunk::FromAddress(MetadataAddress())->address();
69 }
70
71 private:
72 friend class ReadOnlySpace;
73};
74
75// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
76// Artifacts used to construct a new SharedReadOnlySpace
77class ReadOnlyArtifacts {
78 public:
79 virtual ~ReadOnlyArtifacts() = default;
80
81 // Initialize the ReadOnlyArtifacts from an Isolate that has just been created
82 // either by serialization or by creating the objects directly.
83 virtual void Initialize(Isolate* isolate,
84 std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>&& pages,
85 const AllocationStats& stats) = 0;
86
87 // This replaces the ReadOnlySpace in the given Heap with a newly constructed
88 // SharedReadOnlySpace that has pages created from the ReadOnlyArtifacts. This
89 // is only called for the first Isolate, where the ReadOnlySpace is created
90 // during the bootstrap process.
91
92 virtual void ReinstallReadOnlySpace(Isolate* isolate) = 0;
93 // Creates a ReadOnlyHeap for a specific Isolate. This will be populated with
94 // a SharedReadOnlySpace object that points to the Isolate's heap. Should only
95 // be used when the read-only heap memory is shared with or without pointer
96 // compression. This is called for all subsequent Isolates created after the
97 // first one.
98 virtual ReadOnlyHeap* GetReadOnlyHeapForIsolate(Isolate* isolate) = 0;
99
100 virtual void VerifyHeapAndSpaceRelationships(Isolate* isolate) = 0;
101
102 std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>& pages() { return pages_; }
103
104 void set_accounting_stats(const AllocationStats& stats) { stats_ = stats; }
105 const AllocationStats& accounting_stats() const { return stats_; }
106
107 void set_shared_read_only_space(
108 std::unique_ptr<SharedReadOnlySpace> shared_space) {
109 shared_read_only_space_ = std::move(shared_space);
110 }
111 SharedReadOnlySpace* shared_read_only_space() {
112 return shared_read_only_space_.get();
113 }
114
115 void set_read_only_heap(std::unique_ptr<ReadOnlyHeap> read_only_heap);
116 ReadOnlyHeap* read_only_heap() const { return read_only_heap_.get(); }
117
118 void set_initial_next_unique_sfi_id(uint32_t id) {
119 initial_next_unique_sfi_id_ = id;
120 }
121 uint32_t initial_next_unique_sfi_id() const {
122 return initial_next_unique_sfi_id_;
123 }
124
125 struct ExternalPointerRegistryEntry {
126 ExternalPointerRegistryEntry(ExternalPointerHandle handle, Address value,
127 ExternalPointerTag tag)
128 : handle(handle), value(value), tag(tag) {}
129 ExternalPointerHandle handle;
130 Address value;
131 ExternalPointerTag tag;
132 };
133 void set_external_pointer_registry(
134 std::vector<ExternalPointerRegistryEntry>&& registry) {
135 DCHECK(external_pointer_registry_.empty());
136 external_pointer_registry_ = std::move(registry);
137 }
138 const std::vector<ExternalPointerRegistryEntry>& external_pointer_registry()
139 const {
140 return external_pointer_registry_;
141 }
142
143 void InitializeChecksum(SnapshotData* read_only_snapshot_data);
144 void VerifyChecksum(SnapshotData* read_only_snapshot_data,
145 bool read_only_heap_created);
146
147 protected:
148 ReadOnlyArtifacts() = default;
149
150 std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*> pages_;
151 AllocationStats stats_;
152 std::unique_ptr<SharedReadOnlySpace> shared_read_only_space_;
153 std::unique_ptr<ReadOnlyHeap> read_only_heap_;
154 uint32_t initial_next_unique_sfi_id_ = 0;
155 std::vector<ExternalPointerRegistryEntry> external_pointer_registry_;
156#ifdef DEBUG
157 // The checksum of the blob the read-only heap was deserialized from, if
158 // any.
159 base::Optional<uint32_t> read_only_blob_checksum_;
160#endif // DEBUG
161};
162
163// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
164// Artifacts used to construct a new SharedReadOnlySpace when pointer
165// compression is disabled and so there is a single ReadOnlySpace with one set
166// of pages shared between all Isolates.
167class SingleCopyReadOnlyArtifacts : public ReadOnlyArtifacts {
168 public:
169 ~SingleCopyReadOnlyArtifacts() override;
170
171 ReadOnlyHeap* GetReadOnlyHeapForIsolate(Isolate* isolate) override;
172 void Initialize(Isolate* isolate, std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>&& pages,
173 const AllocationStats& stats) override;
174 void ReinstallReadOnlySpace(Isolate* isolate) override;
175 void VerifyHeapAndSpaceRelationships(Isolate* isolate) override;
176
177 private:
178 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator_ = nullptr;
179};
180
181// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
182// Artifacts used to construct a new SharedReadOnlySpace when pointer
183// compression is enabled and so there is a ReadOnlySpace for each Isolate with
184// with its own set of pages mapped from the canonical set stored here.
185class PointerCompressedReadOnlyArtifacts : public ReadOnlyArtifacts {
186 public:
187 ReadOnlyHeap* GetReadOnlyHeapForIsolate(Isolate* isolate) override;
188 void Initialize(Isolate* isolate, std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>&& pages,
189 const AllocationStats& stats) override;
190 void ReinstallReadOnlySpace(Isolate* isolate) override;
191 void VerifyHeapAndSpaceRelationships(Isolate* isolate) override;
192
193 private:
194 SharedReadOnlySpace* CreateReadOnlySpace(Isolate* isolate);
195 Tagged_t OffsetForPage(size_t index) const { return page_offsets_[index]; }
196 void InitializeRootsIn(Isolate* isolate);
197 void InitializeRootsFrom(Isolate* isolate);
198
199 std::unique_ptr<v8::PageAllocator::SharedMemoryMapping> RemapPageTo(
200 size_t i, Address new_address, ReadOnlyPageMetadata*& new_page);
201
202 static constexpr size_t kReadOnlyRootsCount =
203 static_cast<size_t>(RootIndex::kReadOnlyRootsCount);
204
205 Address read_only_roots_[kReadOnlyRootsCount];
206 std::vector<Tagged_t> page_offsets_;
207 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<PageAllocator::SharedMemory>> shared_memory_;
208};
209
210// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
211// Read Only space for all Immortal Immovable and Immutable objects
212class ReadOnlySpace : public BaseSpace {
213 public:
214 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE explicit ReadOnlySpace(Heap* heap);
215
216 // Detach the pages and add them to artifacts for using in creating a
217 // SharedReadOnlySpace. Since the current space no longer has any pages, it
218 // should be replaced straight after this in its Heap.
219 void DetachPagesAndAddToArtifacts(
220 std::shared_ptr<ReadOnlyArtifacts> artifacts);
221
222 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE ~ReadOnlySpace() override;
223 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE virtual void TearDown(MemoryAllocator* memory_allocator);
224
225 bool IsDetached() const { return heap_ == nullptr; }
226
227 bool writable() const { return !is_marked_read_only_; }
228
229 bool Contains(Address a) = delete;
230 bool Contains(Tagged<Object> o) = delete;
231
232 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE
233 AllocationResult AllocateRaw(int size_in_bytes,
234 AllocationAlignment alignment);
235
236 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void ClearStringPaddingIfNeeded();
237
238 enum class SealMode {
239 kDetachFromHeap,
240 kDetachFromHeapAndUnregisterMemory,
241 kDoNotDetachFromHeap
242 };
243
244 // Seal the space by marking it read-only, optionally detaching it
245 // from the heap and forgetting it for memory bookkeeping purposes (e.g.
246 // prevent space's memory from registering as leaked).
247 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void Seal(SealMode ro_mode);
248
249 // During boot the free_space_map is created, and afterwards we may need
250 // to write it into the free space nodes that were already created.
251 void RepairFreeSpacesAfterDeserialization();
252
253 size_t Size() const override { return accounting_stats_.Size(); }
254 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE size_t CommittedPhysicalMemory() const override;
255
256 const std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>& pages() const { return pages_; }
257 Address top() const { return top_; }
258 Address limit() const { return limit_; }
259 size_t Capacity() const { return capacity_; }
260
261 // Returns the index within pages_. The chunk must be part of this space.
262 size_t IndexOf(const MemoryChunkMetadata* chunk) const;
263
264 bool ContainsSlow(Address addr) const;
265 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void ShrinkPages();
266#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
267 void Verify(Isolate* isolate, SpaceVerificationVisitor* visitor) const final;
268#ifdef DEBUG
269 void VerifyCounters(Heap* heap) const;
270#endif // DEBUG
271#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
272
273 // Return size of allocatable area on a page in this space.
274 int AreaSize() const { return static_cast<int>(area_size_); }
275
276 Address FirstPageAddress() const { return pages_.front()->ChunkAddress(); }
277
278 // Ensure the read only space has at least one allocated page
279 void EnsurePage();
280
281 protected:
282 friend class SingleCopyReadOnlyArtifacts;
283
284 void SetPermissionsForPages(MemoryAllocator* memory_allocator,
285 PageAllocator::Permission access);
286
287 bool is_marked_read_only_ = false;
288
289 // Accounting information for this space.
290 AllocationStats accounting_stats_;
291
292 std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*> pages_;
293
294 Address top_;
295 Address limit_;
296
297 private:
298 // Unseal the space after it has been sealed, by making it writable.
299 void Unseal();
300
301 void DetachFromHeap() { heap_ = nullptr; }
302
303 AllocationResult AllocateRawUnaligned(int size_in_bytes);
304 AllocationResult AllocateRawAligned(int size_in_bytes,
305 AllocationAlignment alignment);
306 Tagged<HeapObject> TryAllocateLinearlyAligned(int size_in_bytes,
307 AllocationAlignment alignment);
308
309 // Return the index within pages_ of the newly allocated page.
310 size_t AllocateNextPage();
311 size_t AllocateNextPageAt(Address pos);
312 void InitializePageForDeserialization(ReadOnlyPageMetadata* page,
313 size_t area_size_in_bytes);
314 void FinalizeSpaceForDeserialization();
315
316 void EnsureSpaceForAllocation(int size_in_bytes);
317 void FreeLinearAllocationArea();
318
319 size_t capacity_;
320 const size_t area_size_;
321
322 friend class Heap;
323 friend class ReadOnlyHeapImageDeserializer;
324};
325
326class SharedReadOnlySpace : public ReadOnlySpace {
327 public:
328 explicit SharedReadOnlySpace(Heap* heap) : ReadOnlySpace(heap) {
329 is_marked_read_only_ = true;
330 }
331
332 SharedReadOnlySpace(Heap* heap,
333 PointerCompressedReadOnlyArtifacts* artifacts);
334 SharedReadOnlySpace(
335 Heap* heap, std::vector<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>&& new_pages,
336 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<::v8::PageAllocator::SharedMemoryMapping>>&&
337 mappings,
338 AllocationStats&& new_stats);
339 SharedReadOnlySpace(Heap* heap, SingleCopyReadOnlyArtifacts* artifacts);
340 SharedReadOnlySpace(const SharedReadOnlySpace&) = delete;
341
342 void TearDown(MemoryAllocator* memory_allocator) override;
343
344 // Holds any shared memory mapping that must be freed when the space is
345 // deallocated.
346 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<v8::PageAllocator::SharedMemoryMapping>>
347 shared_memory_mappings_;
348};
349
350} // namespace internal
351
352namespace base {
353// Define special hash function for page pointers, to be used with std data
354// structures, e.g. std::unordered_set<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*,
355// base::hash<ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>
356template <>
357struct hash<i::ReadOnlyPageMetadata*> : hash<i::MemoryChunkMetadata*> {};
358template <>
359struct hash<const i::ReadOnlyPageMetadata*>
360 : hash<const i::MemoryChunkMetadata*> {};
361} // namespace base
362
363} // namespace v8
